primary_categories.name: Antisemitic Ideology
primary_categories.description: Educational content countering calls for annihilation, conspiracy theories, or portraying Jewish people as evil

primary_categories.name: Indirect Antisemitism
primary_categories.description: Educational content countering mentions of Jewish/Israeli public figures with antisemitic implications

detailed_scores.reasoning: This document does not directly address general hate or discrimination, but it does provide information about white supremacist groups and their use of numeric symbols to promote hatred. While this content may indirectly contribute to a broader understanding of prejudice and discrimination, it is not primarily focused on countering general hate.

This document provides information about the origins and significance of the "14 Words" slogan, which is a well-known antisemitic ideology. By explaining the meaning and use of this slogan, the document helps to counter calls for annihilation and conspiracy theories that target Jewish people.

This document does not address stereotypes or dehumanization about Jewish people specifically. While it provides information about white supremacist groups, this content is primarily focused on their ideology and symbolism rather than the targeting of Jewish people.

This document does not address anti-Israel or anti-Zionist narratives specifically. While it provides information about white supremacist groups, this content is primarily focused on their ideology and symbolism rather than the targeting of Israel or Zionism.

This document does not address Holocaust denial or minimization specifically. While it provides information about white supremacist groups, this content is primarily focused on their ideology and symbolism rather than the targeting of the Holocaust.

This document addresses how public figures are unfairly targeted by white supremacist groups, which can be seen as an indirect form of antisemitic targeting. By providing information about these groups and their tactics, the document helps to counter indirect forms of antisemitism that target Jewish people or Israel.
